question: I've got the five stores here and then two in Rio Rancho.
answer: That's fantastic. See, if we're talking that kind of volume I can absolutely massage the numbers a little. Seriously, you're not gonna be able to keep it on the shelf.

question: Yeah, I'd need to look at some things before I can place an order. How about I give you a call if I decide to--
answer: I'll call you. Not a problem. No problem at all. Even better, I'll swing by. You're on my route. How `bout that? I'll swing by tomorrow.

question: Yeah, tomorrow's not good.
answer: Thursday then. That's better anyway. That'll give you a chance to take a look see on those other stores. We'll put everything on one order and get you a good price break. My advice to you - weed out some of this weaker product to make more space for the corn. Like this... Apricot Fruit Leather. Whose bright idea was it to stock that? I mean come on, what self respecting kid asks his mom for apricot fruit leather?

question: The fact that we have sex, real coitus sex, means I'm under no obligation to blow you.
answer: I think you're scared of it.

question: I'm not scared of it.
answer: Uncomfortable then. You just need to get better acquainted.

question: Dad, get the phone.
answer: There's absolutely no pressure here. You can touch it if you want.

question: Hello.
answer: You haven't left yet? Damn it Norah, my class starts in fifteen minutes.

question: I know, I know. Sorry.
answer: I'm gonna be so late.

question: I brought fancy corn!
answer: How can you eat that stuff? He'll be hyper all night. Be good. And no lobsterman stories. He had nightmares all week. Just use some common sense.

question: You're welcome.
answer: You want me?

question: He's slowly freezing to death and he knows lobsterman is out there... somewhere... coming for him. And he's totally screwed because his tongue is stuck to the mailbox.
answer: Why did he lick the mailbox?

question: I don't know. Maybe he had OCD and he was obsessed with licking mailboxes.
answer: Why wasn't he in school?

question: Are you gonna let me tell the story? An then, he hears a horrible sound. Snap, snap, drag. Snap, snap, drag. Lobsterman is coming.
answer: Maybe he didn't go to school because he had the ACD. Sorry.

question: Still sore? I don't know why you did that.
answer: You should hear the way he goes on about his lean body mass index bullshit. Drinking that antioxidant, protein powder, enzyme crap all the time.

question: When was the last time you even played basketball?
answer: He needed to be brought down a peg or two.

question: I'm sure you pulling a groin muscle humbled him.
answer: I should introduce him to your sister.

question: Norah and a cop? That would happen.
answer: We were working a scene today where this guy offs himself in a sporting goods store. So they had this cleaning crew out there, right? You would not believe how much money they charge for that shit. It's ridiculous.

question: With the dead body there?
answer: Naw, the body's gone, it's just the blood and stuff.

question: Sounds horrible.
answer: You ask me it's a racket. You should get into that.

question: You think that's all I can do? Clean other people's shit?
answer: Come here. You know that's not what I think.

question: I am gonna be a real estate agent.
answer: I know. With business cards.

question: It's about time. I thought your class got over at 9:30.
answer: Why isn't he in bed?

question: Said he was scared. I think he was fakin' it though. I'm not taking money.
answer: It's just ten bucks, take it. Dad told me about you getting fired. What happened?

question: Nothing.
answer: What, were you stoned or something?

question: It was just Mr. Kim being a dick head.
answer: I thought you liked Mr. Kim.

question: Yeah, before Mrs. Kim started working there. Now he's a full on gym teacher, I swear to God.
answer: When are you going to grow up and start taking responsibility for--

question: Oh please, you love it when I fuck up. Love it. Me screwing up gives you the hugest woody.
answer: Shut up and take the ten.

question: There was a diner scene earlier. With a waitress.
answer: Any pie?

question: Completely pie free.
answer: We're all finished. Since it's our first visit we did the blinds and appliances but normally we'll alternate those weekly. Nobody mentioned anything to us about laundry so we didn't bother with that but if you want laundry included there is an extra...

question: We're all finished. Since it's our first visit we did the blinds and appliances but normally we'll alternate those weekly. Nobody mentioned anything to us about laundry so we didn't bother with that but if you want laundry included there is an extra...
answer: Rose? Rose Lorkowski? It's Paula Datzman... cheerleading squad junior year.

question: Paula Datzman. Wow. How are you?
answer: Great! I'm Paula Datzman-Mead now.

question: Congratulations.
answer: Thanks. We're expecting our second in a couple of months. How are you? You look just the same.

question: I'm good. Really good!
answer: God, I always envied you so much. Head cheerleader... dating the quarterback... So did you and Mac end up getting married?

question: Nope. No. I'm not sure...I think he ended up marrying Heather Volkman.
answer: Wow. Well it's so good to see you. Let me get your info so I can send you an invite to the baby shower. It'll be like a big reunion. The whole gang from high school will be there. So what are you doing now?

question: I... I've just gotten my real estate license, and so...
answer: Real estate?

question: Yeah, this... this is just kind of a temporary thing and I'm about to just really phase over into the real estate full time.
answer: You're kidding, I'm in real estate! With Long and Foster. Who are you with?

question: Me? Um. You know, I haven't really decided yet. I might check out Long and Foster.
answer: Maybe you'll just be independent.

question: Yeah. Maybe.
answer: What was that about the laundry?

question: Hello.
answer: It's not just this incident. There have been several episodes over the past year where Oscar has... has engaged in disruptive behavior. There was the incident in gym class.

question: I did pay the damages for that.
answer: And the chalk thing. And the time he locked Jeremy Johnston in the--

question: Okay. What did he do this time?
answer: Now it's... licking. Oscar has started licking things in the classroom. It's unsanitary. And it's disturbing to the other children. We think Oscar might benefit from an environment where he could receive more specialized attention.

question: Where'd you get those?
answer: Up there.

question: Come here. Those were your grandma's. She'd watch birds with those. Hey, hey. Careful. Why don't we put those away.
answer: Why can't I play with them?

question: Because it's not a toy. It's a scientific instrument. You can play with them when I'm around to supervise.
answer: You're around now.

question: Hello.
answer: Mac, it's me.

question: What are you doing calling here?
answer: I know, I'm sorry.

question: Heather could have easily--
answer: I thought she had yoga on Saturdays.

question: Still, it's not cool.
answer: I know, I'm sorry. I just needed to ask you... you know the other day... you said that... about the specialized cleaning guys making so much money... Are you even listening?

question: World's finest corn snack.
answer: Bet you could get a chunk of change for your place. You should cash out now before the market turns sour.

question: I'm not selling my house. No way. I don't care how much those idiots would shell out for it. I got history in that house. You think they understand about history?
answer: Still... How much commission you get on that popcorn? Bet you gotta sell a lot of corn to-

question: Hey, the corn's good. Really good. Not like the pet food but that was a phenomenon. It'll get there. Takes time to get to know the market. Develop a relationship with the buyers. But it'll get there. Who doesn't like popcorn for Christ's sake.
answer: My brother-in-law's in sales. Last year he buys a cow.

question: Why would you buy a cow?
answer: Not a live cow. A whole butchered cow from a rancher. On the hoof they call it.

question: Mm hmm.
answer: He sells off the parts of this cow to a bunch of restaurants. Direct. Made a killing.

question: What do you want?
answer: Mac got us another gig.

question: I'm sleeping.
answer: I'll pick you up in an hour.

question: No. You suck.
answer: Money.

question: You still suck.
answer: Apparently some crazy bag lady squatter person died and--

question: You didn't get me coffee?

question: Of course I... How long is this gonna take?
answer: All we have to do is go in and throw everything away. Cake. Great, now we're gonna have to clean that up too. Where are you going?

question: There is no way.
answer: You said you would help me.

question: Maybe if you'd gotten me a coffee. I'm standing here. What do we do with that?
answer: Dumpster?

question: You're telling me this Fancy Corn stuff is some kind of health food?
answer: Well, it's a candy... and a health food. Absolutely. Absolutely.

question: Yeah, I don't know. We don't have much more shelf space.
answer: Glycerol monostearate? What is that? I can't even read that. Read that.

question: High fructose--
answer: No. The first thing listed. The number one ingredient.

question: Corn.
answer: Exactly. Corn. Can you think of anything more wholesome? It's all American for Christ's sake.

question: It seems wrong though doesn't it... to throw everything away. I bet this is her. Wow, look at this. Think it's her daughter? Shouldn't we do something? Try to find her or something?
answer: That's none of your business, Norah. Hand me that.

question: What if she doesn't know? Wouldn't you want to know if this was mom?
answer: Mom was never like this. Mom would never have been like this.

question: I wonder how she died?
answer: Damnit Norah, we still have a lot of shit to do here. Are you just gonna talk?

question: That was real good. You're a natural. You got the timing, you got the nerve. You're a real sharp cookie, you know that?
answer: No I'm not. I'm stupid.

question: You're not stupid. What are you saying? You're not stupid.
answer: Yes I am. They want to put me in retard classes.

question: Don't say that.
answer: What?

question: It's those teachers who are retarded. You're probably just too advanced for those classes. You're bored. Do you get bored in class?
answer: Yeah.

question: See. You're too smart! And those teachers just don't know how to handle you. You're probably a goddamn genius.
answer: You think so?

question: It was so disgusting. I mean the smell, you would not believe. There were flies everywhere and, really, the smell. I can't even describe it.

question: But, after we finished... you woulda never even known. We took all that away... made it right.
answer: I can't believe you... I mean, I feel like I got you into this mess.

question: No, I--

question: Freak.

question: Curb appeal. Why'd you pick her?

question: No.
answer: If this is going to get all heavy--

question: Really smelly job where the lady had died and they didn't find her for a while and it was really...

question: Turns out it's against the law to throw bio hazards in the dumpster. Who knew? How perfect was he with the one arm?

question: The creepy guy. Do you think he was born like that?

question: Dude, he has one arm.

question: What?
answer: Shit! This is not happening. Listen, I'm sorry. I thought... I thought you were following me.

question: That's all right.
answer: You think I'm crazy.

question: No. No I don't.
answer: I'm not crazy.

question: It was a mistake. No big deal.
answer: It's not moving.

question: Let's press the alarm button.
answer: Go to the university?

question: Me? No. Hobby... There's this gorilla who knows sign language and I've always thought that would have to be the most amazing thing ever. You know? To actually talk to a gorilla.
answer: I think I've seen something on--

question: KoKo.
answer: Yeah, yeah, with the kitten.

question: Kitten died. It wasn't KoKo's fault. She was heartbroken.

question: That's what's so cool about it.
answer: I'm sorry again about the...

question: Hi. Could you tell me what time you have? Okay. Thanks. I am strong. I am powerful. I am a winner. I'm a fucking idiot.
answer: You're back early.

question: I'm quitting real estate.

question: Oscar!
answer: That's all right.

question: I was thinking maybe I could set a few out by the register?

answer: Funeral Homes, property managers... What you really want is to get in with the insurance companies. They can throw you a ton of work. Do you guys have your B.B.P. certification?

answer: Blood Born Pathogens. The big money jobs... they'll expect you to be certified. I can register you for the next seminar if you want.

question: Antenna's probably broke.

question: Ahh! Lick around the base. Secure the perimeter. Don't you teach this kid anything?

answer: We have snacks you know. Juice boxes.

answer: No, no. That was a whole big mess.

question: Crappy zippers. Wasn't that it?

question: Food's better at the bar. Carl Swanson, Above and Beyond.
answer: Rose- Rose Lorkowski. Nice to meet you.

question: I hear you're my new competition.

question: I'm glad to see you're doing a little homework. A lot of people, you know, they think they can just jump in to this, make lots of money. But, they don't know what they're doing. No idea. They're not professional and that makes us all look bad.
answer: Well, we're not like that. I just have to complete this seminar and we're certified.

question: You're not certified?
answer: Not yet. Probably by the end of the month.

question: You had a...

question: You just figure all this shit out as you go. Experience.
answer: It's not how I thought it'd be. I thought it'd be gross. Sometimes it's gross. The maggots are gross. The maggots kind of freak me.

question: Yeah.
answer: The sound. The munching sound.

question: And it's so hard to kill the little fuckers.

question: Just roll their eyes and call you a pussy.

question: Would you like to sit for a moment, Mrs. Davis?
answer: Yes dear, I think I would.

question: That lady seemed really sad.
answer: Her husband died.

question: So he's in heaven? Maybe we could let her use our CB and she could talk to him. Maybe he would hear her.
answer: Maybe.

question: I won a million dollars!
answer: Let me see that. You gotta get two hydrants with a matching amount. See? None of your fire hydrants match. And three zeros is a thousand dollars. You woulda won a thousand dollars but it doesn't match anything.

question: What happens if it doesn't match anything?
answer: You toss it and try the next one.

question: I scratched it.

question: We're gonna make the money grow because that's the smart way. It's capital and you don't spend that. You invest it. That way you can get the SP250 and have money left over.

answer: Oh it is fun. Would you like a refreshment? No? Can you squeeze that for me? That's good. One more time.

question: Oh my God, is that the needle? It's a fucking cocktail straw.

question: You might have oversold it.
answer: Kind of twirl the ball around in your hand. Good. It doesn't hurt, does it?

question: Feels hot.
answer: That's a good sign.

question: My friend's having a thing tonight. Never mind.

question: Nothing it's...

question: I knew you wouldn't have any fun here.
answer: I am having fun. No thanks.

question: Lambs breath.
answer: Yeah, no thanks.

question: Straight edge?
answer: Just kind of superstitious.

question: She's Mormon.
answer: I'm not Mormon. I just... You're gonna think it's weird.

question: What?

answer: I think it weakens you psychically... like it creates these cracks and then bad things can seep in and maybe never go away.

question: All right, you're kind of freakin me out.

question: You should just tell people you're Mormon.
answer: I think your boyfriend is winning.

question: Yes. Yes, he is.
answer: Breathe.

question: I need more beer. Um. Can I get you anything?
answer: I'm good.

question: What are you doing?
answer: Shh. Hello.

question: Unbelievable.
answer: Yeah, I'm watching it now.

question: Legally, it's not really necessary.
answer: We are.

question: We're in the process.
answer: You went to that thing.

question: That Above and Beyond guy was there. Carl. We got talking shop and--

question: I'm already registered for the next one.

question: I'm sorry. I know it was stupid.
answer: On so many levels.

question: I'm really sorry. I swear it won't happen again. It's just... you weren't around and...

answer: Yeah, I don't. I should, but I don't. And you're a really great guy. But...I don't care if you have sex with the rabbit lady... and I mean, it seems like I should care about that.

question: Shit.
answer: Rose.

question: What are you doing here?

question: Oscar's asleep.
answer: It was great seeing you last night. You looked so professional and confident. Your own business...

question: How's the baby?
answer: I just wanted to congratulate you on the business. Seems like things are really going great for you.

question: They are. If we keep going at this rate I can hire a couple of employees soon, put a little more in marketing, give those Clean Sweep guys a run for their money. I'm a business woman.
answer: You're a business woman.

question: Ever been trestling?
answer: Are the bodies there?

question: No. The person is gone. It's weird `cuz we're connected to them in this strangely intimate way... but we never actually meet them. It's just kind of weird. I have seen a dead body once though.
answer: Yeah?

question: My mom. She was in a movie of the week once, ya know.
answer: Your mom?

question: A bunch of Hollywood people were filming down in Old Town. They thought my mom was so beautiful and so talented that they gave her a speaking part. You want to hear it? `I recommend the pecan pie.'
answer: I recommend the pecan pie?

question: That was her line. It was on TV and everything.
answer: That's pretty cool.

question: Me and Rose, we didn't actually see it but Rose says mom talked about it all the time. I don't remember. I don't remember her much at all. I have this box of her stuff though, little things she touched. When it seems like she never even really existed... it's proof. All right. This is where we climb.
answer: What?

question: Best place to be when it comes.

question: You're gonna miss the best part.

question: It's like... it's like this big pissed off God up in your face just screaming at you. So close you can smell the metal on his breath.

answer: Oh, shit. You idiot.

question: Sneaky fucker.

question: Blow off the shower.

question: Seems like it'd be hard to build models with just one hand.

question: Really?

question: A real estate business?
answer: No. It's a biohazard removal and crime scene clean up service. It's a growth niche industry right now  highly technical and competitive.

question: What does that mean  biohazard removal whatever?
answer: A lot of times, when somebody dies, it can be kind of, you know, messy. So, we go in and clean up all that left over mess. Make sure that the area is clean and sanitary. People just don't understand the health and safety risks involved in disposing of biological material like blood and body fluids.

question: Oh my God, what have you done?

question: Oh that's great. Turn everything to shit and then walk away. Great.
answer: Long baby shower.

question: I'm sorry, I... everything's horrible.
answer: Oscar's asleep in back.

question: Norah's ruined everything. She burnt down a house. A client's house.
answer: Yeah.

question: You know?
answer: Carl told me.

question: How does he...? That's just great. We burnt down a client's house. How do you get around that?
answer: Insurance?

question: I figured we'd wait and get the better rate once I got certified.
answer: Didn't you go to that?

question: There's not a lot I'm really good at, you know. Really. I'm good at getting guys to want me. Not date or marry me. But want me. I've always been good at that. And cheering. I was pretty good at that too.
answer: Cheering is good.

question: Yeah. Not as marketable as you'd think. You brush your teeth?
answer: Rose? Hey beautiful. I was starting to think you were on a date or something. You okay?

question: Long day.
answer: Can I come in?

question: It's not really a good time.
answer: I got you something. It's for your business cards. You put `em in there and, I don't know... impress people.

question: It's beautiful.
answer: You don't like it?

question: No, I like it very much. It's just this thing we're doing.
answer: Come on, let's not do that.

question: I don't want this anymore.
answer: So that's it? That's it then.

question: No. I need to talk to Lynn.
answer: She can't donate. You can't donate. Forty-eight days. It's not been forty-eight days.

question: Why are you acting like this? Why haven't you called me back.
answer: Listen, I just, don't think you're the kind of person I need to be hanging out with right now.

question: What's that supposed to mean?
answer: Do I really need to spell it out?

question: Winston cleans up pretty good. I read somewhere that beauty is really all about symmetry. Like having eyes the same size and all that. So, you know, when you factor that in he's like, hot. Listen, I know I fucked up, okay? Like really huge and I know that and I'm sorry, okay?
answer: God, that drives me crazy! That whole `Oh, I'm sorry, I'm just a big fuck up' routine. Like that's a legitimate excuse.

question: I really am sorry. But it really isn't all my fault, Rose.
answer: I think there's something wrong with you. The way your brain works. I mean, what the hell? It's like you can't be trusted with anything. You just screw around all the time like it's all a big fucking game. It wasn't a game, Norah. We're not all just here for your amusement. You should have been paying attention. You should have been focused on the job.

question: You finished?
answer: I know. I should have been there.

question: What are you going to do now?
answer: I got some ideas. I was thinking maybe we could--

question: I've got my own ideas.
answer: So, you really think he's hot?

question: Turn your TV on. Channel sixty- five. Hello? Mom? Oscar turned eight today. We had this whole big thing at Hinkle's. Winston came. After dinner Oscar and Norah got a high score on Centipede and put in ASS as their initials and got in trouble by the manager. I don't know if you're in heaven or what. But you're not here and that's too bad for you `cuz you've missed out. You've missed out on some really great stuff. Dad?
answer: There's something I wanted to talk to you about.

question: Okay.
answer: Well, I was wondering if I could move in with you and Oscar.

question: What?
answer: Just temporarily - until I find a place.

question: You lost the house. Oh my god, you lost the house. Dad how could you lose the house?
answer: I didn't lose the house. I sold the house. There's this business opportunity--

question: Not shrimp I hope.
answer: It's not just some get rich quick scheme. And I got a partner who has experience. I'd learn from her.

question: Nineteen sixty-three?
answer: Don't make a big deal out of it.

question: Dad.
answer: It's a business lie, not a real lie.

question: I can live with that.
answer: And you'd be the boss.
